Completion Prompts: Capture one daily action that aligns with your legacy vision.
Name one habit you will adopt to protect your legacy work.
Identify one way you will measure progress toward your legacy.

Related Protocols: Cost Lines to Bless or Cut
Unit Economics as a Living Compass

Overall Outcomes.Excellent: Daily rhythm is consciously linked to long-term vision → The future steadily builds the intended legacy.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: Some work aligns to long-term goals but without consistent tracking → The future delivers partial legacy building.
Overall Outcomes.Poor: Daily work is disconnected from long-term vision → The future sees fragmented results and unfulfilled mission.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Legacy rhythm is cultural DNA → The future flourishes with sustained impact and integrity.

Overall Purpose: To align daily actions and long-term vision so that the work we do now contributes meaningfully to the legacy we want to leave.

Guiding Questions: What is the legacy we want to leave?
How will people experience our work years from now?
What would make this legacy worth the effort?
Themes.Name: Defining the Legacy You Want

Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Effort compounds toward a clear impact.
Excellent.Edge condition: You update the vision as context evolves.
Excellent.Example moves: Writing a legacy statement for the team.
Excellent.Present pattern: Legacy is clearly defined and documented.
Excellent.Signals: Frequent reference to legacy in decision-making.

Expected.Edge condition: You treat legacy as an abstract ideal.
Expected.Example moves: Annual vision statements without daily connection.
Expected.Present pattern: Some vision exists but is not revisited often.
Expected.Signals: Occasional reference to mission in planning.

Poor.Example moves: Focusing only on this quarter’s goals.
Poor.Immediate cost: No clear direction for long-term impact.
Poor.Signals: Work feels disconnected from bigger purpose.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Collective action builds a unified legacy.
Transcendent.Edge condition: You refuse to pursue work misaligned with legacy.
Transcendent.Example moves: Starting meetings with a legacy checkpoint.
Transcendent.Future effect: Legacy becomes inevitable and deeply aligned.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Legacy definition is a living part of culture.
Transcendent.Signals: Legacy talk is part of everyday language.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To clarify the lasting impact you want your work to have.
Themes.Why This Matters: Without clarity on the legacy, rhythm drifts toward urgency over meaning.

Guiding Questions: How does today’s work contribute to our legacy?
What daily habit could reinforce our long-term goals?
What are we doing now that doesn’t serve the legacy?
Themes.Name: Connecting Daily Actions to Legacy

Excellent.Edge condition: You use legacy as a filter for priorities.
Excellent.Example moves: Linking daily standups to legacy checkpoints.
Excellent.Present pattern: Daily actions are intentionally tied to legacy outcomes.
Excellent.Signals: Frequent reminders of how work builds legacy.

Expected.Edge condition: You connect legacy to work only in special projects.
Expected.Example moves: Including legacy talk in major planning but not daily work.
Expected.Present pattern: Some daily actions support legacy, others don’t.

Poor.Edge condition: You treat legacy work as occasional.
Poor.Example moves: Focusing on immediate tasks without bigger context.
Poor.Future effect: Daily work fails to add up.
Poor.Present pattern: Daily actions are disconnected from the bigger vision.
Poor.Signals: Frequent questions about why work matters.

Transcendent.Edge condition: You refuse to approve work without legacy alignment.
Transcendent.Example moves: Legacy lens applied to every decision.
Transcendent.Future effect: Legacy emerges as a daily lived reality.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Legacy linkage is embedded in all work habits.
Transcendent.Signals: Team can articulate legacy impact of their work anytime.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To ensure that daily work meaningfully contributes to long-term goals.
Themes.Why This Matters: Small actions, repeated consistently, shape the legacy more than rare big moments.

Guiding Questions: What pressures most often push legacy work aside?
How can we shield it from those pressures?
Themes.Name: Protecting Long-Term Priorities from Short-Term Pressure

Excellent.Edge condition: You set rules for when urgency can override legacy work.
Excellent.Example moves: Dedicated legacy work blocks in the calendar.
Excellent.Present pattern: Legacy priorities are clearly protected in scheduling and resources.

Expected.Edge condition: You allow exceptions without clear rules.
Expected.Example moves: Rescheduling long-term work when deadlines loom.
Expected.Present pattern: Some legacy work is protected, but not consistently.

Poor.Edge condition: You treat urgent as more important than important.
Poor.Example moves: Canceling legacy work for immediate deliverables.
Poor.Present pattern: Legacy work is postponed for short-term gains.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Legacy goals are met or exceeded.
Transcendent.Edge condition: You refuse to let urgency undermine legacy.
Transcendent.Example moves: System-wide rules for safeguarding long-term priorities.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Protecting legacy work is a cultural standard.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To defend legacy-focused work from being overshadowed by urgent but less important demands.
Themes.Why This Matters: Without protection, urgent tasks will always crowd out legacy-building work.

Guiding Questions: How will we measure legacy progress?
What indicators show we’re on track?
How will we celebrate milestones along the way?
Themes.Name: Measuring Progress Toward Legacy

Excellent.Edge condition: You tie measures to legacy definition.
Excellent.Future effect: Legacy progress is visible and celebrated.
Excellent.Present pattern: Legacy progress is measured regularly and clearly.

Expected.Signals: Celebrations happen only for big wins.

Poor.Edge condition: You rely on memory or feeling to gauge progress.
Poor.Signals: Uncertainty about whether legacy is advancing.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Legacy moves forward faster and with greater unity.
Transcendent.Edge condition: You refuse to let legacy go unmeasured.
Transcendent.Future effect: Legacy is tangible and inspiring daily.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Measuring legacy is a cultural habit.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To track and celebrate steps that move the legacy forward.
Themes.Why This Matters: Without measurement, it’s hard to see progress or maintain motivation for long-term goals.

Guiding Questions: How can we live our legacy now?
Where are our actions misaligned with our intended legacy?
What would it look like to embody legacy in small daily ways?
Themes.Name: Living the Legacy Now

Excellent.Edge condition: You model the legacy even in challenge.
Excellent.Example moves: Applying mission values in hard decisions.
Excellent.Present pattern: Daily behavior reflects the intended legacy.

Expected.Edge condition: You live the legacy only when convenient.
Expected.Example moves: Making value-based choices only when easy.
Expected.Present pattern: Some actions reflect the legacy now.

Poor.Edge condition: You delay living the legacy until later.
Poor.Example moves: Acting counter to stated mission under pressure.
Poor.Present pattern: Values and behaviors don’t reflect the intended legacy.
Poor.Signals: ‘Do as I say, not as I do’ culture.

Transcendent.Edge condition: You refuse to compromise present behavior for expedience.
Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding legacy principles into all processes.
Transcendent.Future effect: Legacy is as much present reality as future aspiration.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Living the legacy now is a cultural non-negotiable.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To embody the values and impact of the intended legacy in the present moment.
Themes.Why This Matters: Legacy is not only what you leave—it’s what you live now.

Title: The Rhythm of Legacy
When To Use This Protocol:
When setting strategic priorities
During annual or multi-year planning
To evaluate whether current work aligns with deeper purpose
When facing pressure to compromise long-term values for short-term gains
Why This Matters: Without connecting present choices to long-term impact, teams risk chasing short-term wins that do not build toward a meaningful future. Legacy grows from consistent, intentional rhythm.
